title: Candice Warner flaunts her post-baby body outside a gym in Sydney
text:
She welcomed her third daughter, Isla Rose, in June.

And it seems Candice Warner is committed to getting back into shape, after she was spotted leaving a gym in Coogee, Sydney on Friday.

The 34-year-old cricket WAG looked rather flushed as she stepped into her white Range Rover after working up a sweat.

Working up a sweat! Candice Warner was spotted leaving a gym in Coogee, Sydney on Friday

Candice, who is married to Australian cricketer David Warner, wore a black singlet over a yellow sports bra and a pair of Nike shorts.

The former professional Ironwoman completed her sporty look with fluro sneakers.

Candice appeared to go makeup free for her gym session, and listened to AirPods as she strolled back to her luxury vehicle.

Gym session: The 34-year-old cricket WAG looked rather flushed as she stepped into her white Range Rover after working up a sweat

Candice's husband David was seen leaving the gym shortly afterwards.

The 32-year-old batsman wore loose-fitting black shorts, a grey T-shirt and trainers, and carried an Asics backpack over his shoulders.

As he walked back to his car, David seemed preoccupied with a phone call.

Getting back into it: Candice welcomed her third daughter, Isla Rose, in June

Workout: Candice's husband David Warner was seen leaving the gym shortly afterwards

On call: As he walked back to his car, David seemed preoccupied with a phone call

Candice and David's morning gym session comes after they christened Isla Rose in Sydney late last month.

The proud parents were joined by their older children, Ivy Mae and Indi Rae, as well as family and friends for the special occasion.

'Amazing day today christening our little Isla Rose,' David wrote on Instagram alongside a photo of the family-of-five inside the church.

Special day: Candice and David's morning gym session comes after they christened Isla Rose last month. The couple are pictured with Isla and their older daughters Ivy Mae and Indi Rae

Candice recently spoke about her terrifying childbirth experience with Isla Rose.

She told Woman's Day that Isla had reacted badly to drugs used to induce labour when she was giving birth at St Mary's Hospital in London in June.

'Every time I was contracting, her heart rate would drop dramatically,' she said.

Candice added that David 'did not leave her side' during the ordeal and Isla eventually made it through after a difficult 12-hour labour.

'She just kept fighting - she's definitely got the Warner gritty determination!' she said.
description: The 34-year-old cricket WAG looked rather flushed as she stepped into her white Range Rover after working up a sweat
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
